info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 27 at 11:33PM CDT until May 28 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Concho, Irion, Schleicher and Tom Green.
* WHEN...Until 245 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1132 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Angelo, Mertzon, Christoval, Lake Nasworthy, Twin Buttes Reservoir, Goodfellow Air Force Base, Wall, Knickerbocker, Tankersley, O.C. Fisher Reservoir, San Angelo State Park, Veribest, Vancourt, Grape Creek, Sherwood, Mereta, Arden, Eola, Lowake and Us-67 Near The Irion-Tom Green County Line. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... College Hills and Millbrook, Southwest Blvd and Loop 306, Jackson From Knickerbocker to South Bryant, Howard and Webster, FM 2334 crossing Ninemile Creek, RM 853 crossing Dry Draw, FM 1692 crossing Concho River, FM 1692 crossing Sales Branch, Ranch Road 853 crossing east Rocky Creek and FM 2334 crossing Dry Lipan Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CDT WEDNESDAY

area.areaDesc: Concho, TX; Irion, TX; Schleicher, TX; Tom Green, TX
